result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mari L Caster

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 10, 2022 at 09:30 am.

[MK] cases #22CF191 and #22CF433 called at 8:40am 
Defendant Mari L Caster in court with Attorney Karl Huebner (#22CF191) and Attorney Cassi Nelson (#22CF433).  ADA Theresa Beck in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Huebner asks to withdraw as counsel, now that it has been determined that Ms. Caster qualifies for Public Defender representation. 
The Court discharges Attorney Huebner as counsel [in case #22CF191].
Attorney Nelson indicates that the PD will now appoint her as counsel in the case. 
In response to the Court's inquiry of Ms. Caster regarding her address, Ms. Caster indicates that she is homeless. She provides her current mailing address as: 
c/o Workforce Development Center, 874 Collins Road in Jefferson. 
recess 8:47am 

NEXT:  (1) in case #22CF433 Attorney Huebner has been discharged as court-appointed counsel; if a PD order is not filed today, then the Jefferson PD Office should be added to the mailing matrix in #22CF433, 
 (2) Status Conference on November 10th at 9:30am  [JA-note in comments that case #22CF433 is at prelim stage]

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Status conference on October 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Mari L Caster
Current: 874 Collins Rd, Jefferson, WI 53549 United States  (Effective: 10-05-2022)
Prior: 1321 Madison Ave # 8, Fort Atkinson, WI 53538

[ae] case called 1:38 PM Defendant Mari L Caster appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Cassi Nelson (the PD will appoint counsel likely Atty Huebner).  Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 

The Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
Preliminary Hearing time limit is waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $1,000 Signature Bond without conditions

recess 1:42 pm. 

NEXT: (1) Status Conference on 10/13/22 at 8:30 am with Defendants other case in Branch 1
Defendant has pending case assigned to Branch 1
